page.title: 06OUR NORMAN CHURCH , HARLOW.
page.content: { {St. Mary at Latton}is a Norman church on a Saxon site.It was enlarged and changed many times through the centuries.It was mentioned in the {first Domesday book. } At the door there are two gargoyles; people believed that the faces would keep the evil spirits out. To show the history of the church, members have recently made a set of pictorial kneelers.One shows a monk falling off the tower.People say if you run round the church thirteen times ,knock on the door seven times you see him dropping from above. Another kneeler shows Queen Elizabeth First's signature.She visited Latton three times.Another shows the fire that happened in 1960 . Nowadays the church has a service every day and it is full up on Sunday.
